I'm currently in the process of moving into a flat for my first year at uni. Yesterday, I met the 2 second year students moving into the flat across the hall from me, and they're the only other residents on my floor. One of them was American.
 
After chatting for a while, the American girl asked me “Who does your hair? I love it!”
 
Assuming she meant my colour (because I'm currently a very dark blue) I told her I do it myself.
 
“Wow, I didn't know you could change your hair texture yourself! I want mine to curl like yours.”
 
My hair is naturally 2c / 3a curls. I told her it was natural, and I just hadn't bothered with straightening it today like I usually would. She replied;
 
“But you're white! You can't have hair that's naturally that curly!”
 
…………..
 
I think her flatmate nearly cried.
 
*for reference, I took this picture of my hair before it dried this morning*

article:

Continue Reading
I have met some seriously ignorant people in America, but the following beats the beast.
 
A conversation between me and a fellow passenger in a domestic flight from Boston to Atlanta:
 
Me (sitting in the seat next to window): Hi, can you please give me some way to move out?
 
Her: Sure.
 
After few minutes, I come back to my seat and she provides me the space for path.
 
Her: Uff! I hate these economy class seats.
 
Me: Yeah, sort of same here. I can understand you.
 
Her: So you look like a foreigner. Where are you from?
 
Me: Yes, I’m from Singapore
 
Her: Oh Singapore that is close to Africa, am I right?
 
Me(pretty surprised as the question sounded too dumb coming from her): No Singapore is closer to Indonesia. It’s in South East Asia.
 
Her: I don’t know about SE Asia. I had not been to any Asian country.
 
Me: Ok I got you.
 
Her: Why do all Asians look alike? I mean I cannot differentiate between people from Asian countries like China and Australia.
 
Me: (completely shocked, I suppose she is not joking about geography) I don’t get you. Australia is not a part of Asia.
 
Her: Oh, is that so? But isn’t it close to Japan and all that stuff? I presumed it to be a good part of Asia.
 
Me (I wanted to cut the conversation, as I felt I would forget my basic geography): Yeah, sort of. It gets confusing. But Australia is separate. It’s not a part of Asia.
 
Her: So, you mean it’s like Russia? I had been thinking previously Russia was a part of Asia until I understood it’s a separate continent. Good you told me.
 
Me: You’re welcome. I would like to sleep for some time. It was good talking with you.
 
I, then went to sleep. I woke up upon landing. I still wonder how she was so ignorant. I walked with her to the airport entrance till we parted. It was quite a funny experience.
 
PS: She was a middle-aged American woman and she claimed to be from New York City. I am a middle-aged Singaporean woman.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article: I used to volunteer for Planned Parenthood in the late 70s. I answered birth control questions for women my own age, especially oral contraception which was still sort of new. Soooo I was there at my little desk on a Saturday morning when a girl I had talked to came in screaming at me and calling me every bad thing she could think of because she got birth control pills and she put that damn pill “up there” every day and 5 months later she's pregnant anyway. Ooooook then. I didn't realize I had to explain what ORAL meant so she didn't actually swallow it … well there ya go.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I hate to admit that the most ignorant American I have ever met is my own mother. Don’t get me wrong, I love her deeply and appreciate everything she has done for me. And while she is an expert in cooking, cleaning, and local affairs in our small town and is a wonderful and caring person, she lacks understanding of the world outside of the USA.
 
About 11 years ago, I was awarded a Georgetown University English Language Fellowship to Azerbaijan. This was fulfilling my lifetime dream to live overseas. I will admit that I did not know much about the country and spent most of my non-working hours re
Continue Reading
I hate to admit that the most ignorant American I have ever met is my own mother. Don’t get me wrong, I love her deeply and appreciate everything she has done for me. And while she is an expert in cooking, cleaning, and local affairs in our small town and is a wonderful and caring person, she lacks understanding of the world outside of the USA.
 
About 11 years ago, I was awarded a Georgetown University English Language Fellowship to Azerbaijan. This was fulfilling my lifetime dream to live overseas. I will admit that I did not know much about the country and spent most of my non-working hours researching it. I went as far as buying and reading a copy of the Koran as Islam is the predominate religion there.
 
Upon signing the paperwork for the fellowship, I called her to tell her that I would be leaving the country for at least a year. After telling her about my research on Azerbaijan and what I would be doing there, she asked, “What’s it by?”
 
I told her, “Iran is to the south. Armenia, Georgia, and Turkey are to the west. Russia is to the north and the Caspian Sea is to the east.”
 
“That’s not what you told me.”
 
“What do you mean?”
 
“You said it was by some place.”
 
“I told you Iran, Armenia, Georgia, Turkey, Russia, and the Caspian Sea.”
 
“No, you mentioned some other place. Tell the name of the place you are moving to again.”
 
“Azerbaijan.”
 
“Where’s Jan?”
 
“Who’s Jan?”
 
“You said the name of the country is Azer-By-Jan. I want to know where Jan is. I have never heard of that country.”
 
After some time explaining to her that countries generally do not name themselves by giving geographical indicators to other countries within their name (after all, how crazy would the United States of America by Canada and Mexico be?), she finally understood the country’s name was Azerbaijan and Jan is not an actual country.
 
Surprisingly, my father, who only made it to the 8th grade, knew so much about the country based upon watching documentaries on it. He also predicted the Russian attack on Georgia two years before it happened based up Azerbaijan bypassing Russia and using a oil pipeline through Georgia to get its oil into Europe.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

I added in a note about how hard it was to find her place and how all her students would have known it was hers, but ultimately I don’t really know why she chose that particular flag. I do doubt it was to deliberately irk people though, she wasn’t that kind of person.
 
This is a fun story. The exact words said might be slightly off since it’s been about 8 or 9 years now.
 
In college, I took a class on the history of prostitution. It was an intense debate-style class. Graduate level (I was an undergraduate.)
 
At the end of the q
Continue Reading
Edit: Some folks have been wondering why my professor chose such a flag. I added in a note about how hard it was to find her place and how all her students would have known it was hers, but ultimately I don’t really know why she chose that particular flag. I do doubt it was to deliberately irk people though, she wasn’t that kind of person.
 
This is a fun story. The exact words said might be slightly off since it’s been about 8 or 9 years now.
 
In college, I took a class on the history of prostitution. It was an intense debate-style class. Graduate level (I was an undergraduate.)
 
At the end of the quarter, our professor invited us to her place for a class picnic. Since her area of research was communism in Vietnam, she marked the picnic spot with a communist flag tied to a large shrub in the front of her housing complex. It was pretty easy to drive past her place as it was right next to a freeway exit and kind of tucked away. Something large and striking was definitely necessary, and all of her students would have realized that it was hers immediately. In fact, I remember a few of us chuckling over it upon arriving. Make a mental note of that. The flag was being used to mark our picnic spot and was on the housing complex’s property that was facing the street.
 
The picnic went pretty smoothly. We had fun. We ate, we talked, we relaxed. Most of the people had left, but about 7 or 8 of us remained.
 
Suddenly we heard some violent cracking, and turned around to see someone pulling the flag off the shrub. I asked my professor if she wanted me to fetch it and a few of us ran down to retrieve it from the middle-aged lady who was angrily pulling branches off the flag.
 
We politely asked her for the flag back, mentioning that it was our professor’s.
 
Her response was, “YOU CAN’T FLY THIS FLAG IN AMERICA.”
 
Our eyes widened. This is, of course, untrue and we knew it. We asked for the flag back again, calmly and politely. By this time our professor and a few others came down to try and get the flag back.
 
“YOU CAN’T FLY THIS FLAG IN AMERICA! IF YOU’RE GOING TO FLY THIS FLAG IN AMERICA, YOU’VE GOTTA FLY THE AMERICAN FLAG ABOVE IT!”
 
Hoo boy. Our professor calmly told the lady why the flag was there and asked for it back. I should mention that the capslock is entirely warranted. She was yelling at us the entire time.
 
“MY DADDY DIDN’T FIGHT IN IWO JIMA SO YOU COULD FLY THIS FLAG IN AMERICA.”
 
I’m sorry…what? We were all history buffs, if not history majors, so we all knew that the battle of Iwo Jima had very little to do communism.
 
“MY GRANDFATHER BUILT THIS HOUSE.” (She pointed to the house behind her, which was next to the housing complex my professor lived in. What any of this had to do with her grandfather or the house, we had no idea.) “YOU CAN’T FLY THE RUSSIAN COMMUNIST FLAG IN AMERICA.”
 
My professor switched tacks. “That’s actually not the Soviet Communist flag. It’s-”
 
“YOU CAN’T FLY A CHINESE COMMUNIST FLAG IN AMERICA. MY DADDY AND HIS BROTHERS DIDN’T FIGHT IN IWO JIMA SO YOU COULD FLY THIS FLAG HERE.”
 
“It’s not the Chinese Communist flag.”
 
“THEN WHAT IS IT?”
 
“It’s the International Communist Party flag. Could I please have my property back, ma’am?”
 
“NO! I’M GOING TO RIP YOUR FLAG UP AND PUT IT IN THE TRASH!”
 
With this she storms off, leaving her slightly horrified husband/partner/relative/whoever he was standing there holding a bag of groceries. He apologized. My professor told him again that we were just using it to mark our picnic spot and she really just wanted it back. He promised to get it back to her.
 
We students were just kind of dazed. I think a few of us exchanged shocked glances and statements of disbelief like “What does Iwo Jima have to do with this??? World War II wasn’t really about fighting communism???” (Well, kind of…)
 
Then, suddenly, the lady re-emerged carrying a very large American flag on a pole, started waving it around and declared to us:
 
“THIS IS THE ONLY FLAG THAT SHOULD BE FLYING IN AMERICA. IF YOU’RE GOING TO FLY A COMMUNIST FLAG, YOU BETTER FLY THIS FLAG ABOVE IT!”
 
Oh lordy.
 
If I recall correctly, at this point she went back to ranting more about World War II, how much she hated communists, and her relatives who fought in whatever wars. But we were done. The professor said a few words to the man about getting her flag back and we retreated back to our picnic where we tried to process whatever the hell that was.
 
That woman gets my vote for the most ignorant person I’ve ever met in America.
 
I didn’t really expect her to know the difference between the International Communist Party flag or the Russian Communist flag, but like many folks of her type she didn’t seem to understand the basic definition of free speech. We had every right to fly that flag, whether we were actually communists or just using to mark our picnic. Nor is there is a stipulation that we fly an American flag above it.
 
Oh, and the American fighting in the Pacific Theater in World War II didn’t have a whole lot to do with communism. Her father was fighting the Japanese Imperialists, and the Japanese Imperialists were just as anti-communist as we were/are.
 
Edit/Note for future commenters: A lot of folks have already mentioned flying the Nazi flag as a comparison to what my professor did by flying a communist flag. You don’t really need to mention it again. Besides, I disagree that a communist flag provokes the same sort of offense and feeling that a Nazi flag does. Perhaps this is heavy bias on my part considering my personal family history. And now you know why I kind of wish you’d stop bringing up the Nazi flag all the time.
 
A lot of folks have also made the argument that I would get equally mad upon seeing an offensive flag flying in my neighborhood. Well, actually I do have an offensive flag flying in my neighborhood (a Confederate flag) and I do nothing about it. I’d love to get the owner to take it down, but there’s very few ways to do that without starting a fight or making him want to keep displaying it. It’s awful, and I think it’s a terrible thing for the kids in our neighborhood to have to view everyday, especially the kids of color who live really close by.

title: Are there any poor people on Quora, as Internet access is very cheap nowadays?
article:
I am a sick old lady in the US. Everything of any value had to get sold to satisfy what was not covered by philanthropic organization. It was life and death for me; I was no longer young; I am humbly grateful. I live US American-style poverty. A different experience than the answers that I read and updated here.
 
If you are living in US and are wanting to know 
how 
to keep internet services when finances change, I can answer: Yes. I live on my Social Security Disability. I live in housing that is some combination of HUD housing (government-subsidized housing) and private organization which owns a

I am a sick old lady in the US. Everything of any value had to get sold to satisfy what was not covered by philanthropic organization. It was life and death for me; I was no longer young; I am humbly grateful. I live US American-style poverty. A different experience than the answers that I read and updated here.
 
If you are living in US and are wanting to know 
how 
to keep internet services when finances change, I can answer: Yes. I live on my Social Security Disability. I live in housing that is some combination of HUD housing (government-subsidized housing) and private organization which owns and manages fully-accessible apartments for people with disabilities. Because I live in a HUD subsidized apartment and because a national cable company has a program for people who live in HUD housing for a nominal fee. I could either buy my modem/router (cost me 120 USD) or pay 5 USD each month for their router/modem (whatever order those words come in). I have a tablet from housesitting money I earn every other weekend. I earn about 120 USD monthly from that job. That money goes to all things past the monthly bills, medical bills, pharmacy (scripts and OTCs both), and personal and household supplies (limited to the basics). Meaning if I want a pair of shoes or a snack or a speaker for my tablet, that comes out of housesitting money. How truly and humbly grateful I am to be a citizen of US. Completely an accident of birth.
 
Additional Comment. My friends who I housesit for found out that that same national company provides the same nominal costs for senior citizens. He is older than my friend (his wife) and I, so their household qualifies. Others do too, if interested.

article:

It would have to be my classmate in high school. There were several precious instances that I vividly remember.
 
The first one that comes to mind was after a 20 minute lecture by our German teacher of the rise and fall of the Berlin War, my classmate raised her hand to ask how people in Berlin travel from east to west if the wall is blocking the way and if people were forced to circle around the whole city. Everybody turned to look at her since not only did we see footage of the wall being torn down, our teacher passed around a fragment of the wall she collected.
 
Another instance with this classmate was when she found out I was from Mexico. She asked me if I spoke Mexican and if it was hard to adjust to riding in a car instead of a donkey cart. I thought at first she was being extremely rude but apparently she thought all of México was like Hollywood depicts it in Western movies.
 
This is about another person in my high school:
 
I was at my desk reading since I had gotten to class early and was still waiting for the teacher to arrive. A group of boys entered and were conversing loudly amongst themselves. The topic they were discussing was their experiences dealing with the foreign exchange students they were hosting. One in particular was boasting how the English students had never tried Mexican cuisine before so in order to introduce them, they took them to Taco Bell…. At hearing this I started cursing under my breath in Spanish which brought my presence to their attention.
 
“Oh, you're like Mexican right? Do you have any good hard shell taco brands you can recommend? My mom wants to cook them a taco casserole.”
 
I blinked slowly and counted in my head.
 
“Hard taco shells are not considered Mexican, they are Tex Mex and no it is not the same thing. Buy white corn tortillas if you want to expose them to Mexican food”
 
I brought them the next day a jar of my mom’s salsa. They told me it was too spicy for them but that it was good.
 
Update:
 
I forgot one more story possibly because it was so embarrassing I tried to block it.
 
I took a swimming class in high school instead of taking regular PE. I grew up taking swimming lessons year round so changing in the locker room without a towel wrapped around me for modesty never occurred to me to do since we were all girls there. As I was pulling my swimsuit over my chest I felt hands grasp my arms and was twisted to face a classmate. She kept staring at my chest, freaking me out. She starts yelling “OMG your nipples are brown!!! I didn't know there were brown nipples! Why aren't your nipples pink? Did you burn them?”
 
This of course brought forth other white girls who wanted to continue to ogle in amazement in nipples of another color.
 
You would've thought that after that I would have changed with a towel wrapped around me but I only had 15 min to dry myself, change and run to the other side of the building for my next class and keeping the towel around you while you try to shimmy with wet legs into skinny jeans is too much of a hassle. By the third day I wasn't (or rather my areolas) a novelty anymore and was able to change in peace.

Well, this didn’t happen to me, but to a close friend of mine. So this one did strike me as hilarious
 
So my pal happens to visit the United States on an exchange program from Qatar. One weekend, he heads to Miami to party and get drunk with a couple of friends he met at his University. He smokes a couple of joints in his hotel room and heads to one of the most famous night clubs in town.
 
Halfway through the night, he realises he can’t find his passport. He’s Lebanese by descent, and being an Arab, he was petrified by the thought of being caught by the authorities without any documents and the fact that he was high on drugs and alcohol. So he takes a cab and hurries back to his hotel room to search for his passport.
 
As luck has it, his cab gets stopped by cops on the way since he didn’t wear his seat belt, being on the front passenger seat. The cop walks around to him, asks him to roll down his window and asks for indentification. He fumbles through his wallet and pulls out his Qatar civil ID card.
 
Since most of you may not be aware, Qatar is referred to as the “
State of Qatar
” on all official documents. The cop looks at him with a puzzled expression and then questions him, “The State of Qatar?? Is that up north??” My friend(trying to explicitly control his laughter), replies with a sheepish grin, “Yes sir, that’s a new state up north!!!!”. The cop smiles at him, taps him on the back, and lets him be on his way.
 
I don’t think I have come across anything more ignorant or this damn hilarious!!!!

title: Which 3 exercises would give me the most complete workout?
article:
Body weight only:
Pull ups. There are several variations; wide grip, narrow grip, vaulters (one overhand grip the other underhand). Remember good form! The number of reps isn’t as important as keeping great form. Also avoid ‘kipping’ The legs to help propel you up. Keep legs hanging straight. Finally try to do these e-centrically, as in explode up, then Descend for a slow three count to full arm extension. Lather rinse repeat.
Pushups. Also several variations. If you really want your forearms to explode try fingertip pushups with elevated feet. Hands beneath shoulders, palms off the floor and do
Continue Reading
Body weight only:
Pull ups. There are several variations; wide grip, narrow grip, vaulters (one overhand grip the other underhand). Remember good form! The number of reps isn’t as important as keeping great form. Also avoid ‘kipping’ The legs to help propel you up. Keep legs hanging straight. Finally try to do these e-centrically, as in explode up, then Descend for a slow three count to full arm extension. Lather rinse repeat.
Pushups. Also several variations. If you really want your forearms to explode try fingertip pushups with elevated feet. Hands beneath shoulders, palms off the floor and don’t let them touch. Balance weight across all fingers and thumb. Try for eccentric approach as well.
Handstand presses. Place hands on floor slightly wider than shoulders, about 6” away from the wall, facing the wall. Lock elbows. Kick one leg up so it touches the wall and you’re now upside down. Get the other leg up, though it can stay bent for balance. You should now be feeling it in your entire upper body. Lower your body by gradually bending elbows out, the push up and lock elbows. Lather rinse repeat. Be careful with this one!
I approach this grouping in one 60 minute session when traveling without gym facilities available, and it’s a ball buster. I use fingertip pull-ups on door jambs in hotel room, then fingertip pushups with feet on bed then handstand presses. Mix them up for a hypertrophic approach, crank up some German tekno deth metal and off you go!
 
Best of luck!

title: What is a good workout routine at home?
article:
You can always work out at home and have a decent muscular body. Here are some exercises .
 
1. CARDIO: Always warm up your body before workout. U can go for a run. Skipping rope is my personal favorite. And after warm up do some stretching. Try some yoga positions and make sure ur entire body is ready for work out.
 
2. PULL UP: This is by far the best and most difficult exercise. It targets variety of parts on upper body. It focuses on your SHOULDER, BACK, ARMS, FOREARMS. For beginners its really hard to do repetitions. So just make it a point to do 20 pull ups every day taking enough rest but com
Continue Reading
You can always work out at home and have a decent muscular body. Here are some exercises .
 
1. CARDIO: Always warm up your body before workout. U can go for a run. Skipping rope is my personal favorite. And after warm up do some stretching. Try some yoga positions and make sure ur entire body is ready for work out.
 
2. PULL UP: This is by far the best and most difficult exercise. It targets variety of parts on upper body. It focuses on your SHOULDER, BACK, ARMS, FOREARMS. For beginners its really hard to do repetitions. So just make it a point to do 20 pull ups every day taking enough rest but complete 20. Soon your body well get use to your body weight and will become easy.
 
3. CHIN UP: Chin up is a little different from pull ups. Here ur palms are facing towards u and the gap between two hand is less and arms are parallel to each other unlike in pull up position where arms form a V shape. This focuses on 
BICEPS, FOREARMS, BACK.
 
4. PUSH UP: This is one of the basic exercise for upper body. U can change hand position to apply focus on different parts.
 
-- WIDE GRIP : Focuses on CHEST, BICEPS
-- CLOSE GRIP : Focuses on CHEST, TRICEPS
 
U can increase the intensity of workout by making it difficult by keeping ur legs on elevated platform.
 
5. BICYCLE CRUNCH : Best for abdomen. U can google it to see how it is done.
 
6. PLANK : Its a really challenging exercise requires mental stamina. Hold on to it as long as u can and every day try to beat ur previous target. focuses on ABDOMEN, BACK, SHOULDERS.
 
7. -- SIT UPS : For upper abs 
 -- LEG RAISE : For lower abs
 
8. SQUATS : Squats with hands behind ur head is very good for THIGHS, HIPS.
Its word be better if u have some weight on urself to increase intensity.
 
9. CALF RAISES: Standing on ur toes and coming back. Its best if u have some weight on.
 
These exercise will cover almost all major body parts and u can do them separately day wise or mix it up as u like it.
 
DIET : Diet is vey important part of working out. Remember its not the exercise but the food which makes u grow. 
- As u have mentioned you are skinny then make it a point to eat a lot.
- No need to take supplements coz working out at home wont require that much.
- Increase number of meal and don't stay hungry. Eat after every four hours. And eat HEALTY 
- Include bananas, sprouts, eggs whites ( eat at least 6 ), Almonds, Milk , Chicken( prefer boiled leg and chest pieces)
- Eat everything which ur mom cooks.
- Keep monitoring ur weight and check for results and act accordingly
 
Hope this helps you and u get in good shape.

In case of a transaction failure, if one does not receive the refund within 48 hours, they can raise a dispute on the eRupee
 
app by clicking on ‘Raise Dispute’ button or contact Customer Care <1800 1234> or email at 
cbdc@sbi.co.in
 
In case a customer inputs the wrong PIN more than 3 times as day, then the transaction on eRupee app will be temporarily blocked. It is then required to reset the Wallet PIN or wait for 24 hours to unlock.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
The question defines ‘ignorant’ as meaning ‘Not knowing about America itself…’
 
By this definition I would say…I am struck by how many Americans don't know BASIC geography about their own country.
 
I have been on vacation at resorts in Mexico where (on SEVERAL occasions) I’ve had Americans argue with me about where Cuba is (90 miles south of Florida). They think it's somewhere else much farther away in places ranging from South America to the Pacific.
 
I’ve also experienced them not know where Hawaii is, but most commonly - Not know where Alaska is …at all!
 
When I tell them Alaska is above Canada the
Continue Reading
The question defines ‘ignorant’ as meaning ‘Not knowing about America itself…’
 
By this definition I would say…I am struck by how many Americans don't know BASIC geography about their own country.
 
I have been on vacation at resorts in Mexico where (on SEVERAL occasions) I’ve had Americans argue with me about where Cuba is (90 miles south of Florida). They think it's somewhere else much farther away in places ranging from South America to the Pacific.
 
I’ve also experienced them not know where Hawaii is, but most commonly - Not know where Alaska is …at all!
 
When I tell them Alaska is above Canada they think I'm crazy and start mocking the Canadian education system…But I'm never able to determine from them where they think Alaska is.
 
I think there are maps they use in American schools that bring the states of Alaska and Hawaii down and place them off California as islands (just to fit them on the map without having to show Canada) and thus lots of Americans think Alaska and Hawaii are islands near the coast of California.
 
On this theme, many Americans don't know where Seattle Is. I’ll say I'm from Vancouver, Canada. They look at me blankly and ask if that's near Toronto.
 
I’ll respond: “No, Toronto is on the east coast nearer New York and Vancouver is on the Canadian west coast about an hours drive north of Seattle, Washington.”
 
They look at me blankly. Then ask if we have dog sleds.
 
I’ll sometimes get exhausted and say Yes, but we buy them used from Seattle because they are cheaper there.
 
In fairness, I've met many Americans travelling in Europe or Asia and never had this conversation occur. It seems to be just with Americans who vacation in Mexico.
 
PS. My wife just reminded me of the nice older American couple we met this year in Mexico that didn't know there were any currencies in the world beyond the American dollar and Mexican peso. They thought everyone in the world used US dollars. They were fascinated to see our coloured money and hear my story of every country having its own currency.
 
They politely listened but I could tell they thought we were crazy or full of shit. - The idea that Japan and England and every nation has its own money seemed preposterous to them.
 
Really good people though. Very nice and friendly and good company.

title: What is the best workout for me?
article:
Barbell strength training, via Mark Rippetoe's Starting Strength program. It's very effective. In fact i don't think it would be possible to create a more effective program for just getting stronger.
 
I also do hill sprints for conditioning, twice a week at 80% effort on a 30 degree incline, for 15 - 20 seconds, with 40-45 seconds rest. 10 rounds each session. It's effective in that it's improved my overall stamina drastically, while maintaining muscle mass, and it doesn't make me sore (jogging destroys muscle mass and makes me very sore).

title: How workout exercises?
article:
I'm going to assume you are referring to a full body, strength training workout. As a general rule, start with the largest muscle groups and work your way to the smaller. This is so you will be training the most taxing muscle groups when you are freshest. Also, if you train biceps before back for example, your arms will be too fatigued to properly work your much larger back muscles. Larger to smaller. So a full body workout will be arranged like this:
 
Legs
 
Back
 
Chest
 
Shoulders
 
Triceps
 
Biceps
 
Core
 
Calves
 
Hope this helps.

Full body workouts are brilliant for the body. Nothing makes the body stronger than full body exercises. Having done both isolation exercises and full body, a huge thumbs up for your choice of exercise.

You can find a lot of routines online which can suit you. The most important part though is,

 . Within a short span of time, you'll know when to take it light and when to go full steam ahead. 
 
Have a great path to fitness.

title: How workout exercises?
article: I am not sure what you mean by healthy workouts. All workouts can be healthy if you do them right and in the right amount for your goals and capabilities. Too much of anything can be harmful, and too little might not be effective. What you want to do and what you hope to accomplish, will dictate what sort of activity, in what way and how much of it would be healthy for you. So you really need to be more specific. But generaly working out is healthy, as long as you enjoy it, do it regularly, maybe working towards a specific goal, you don’t get injured and so on.

title: Can I do a light workout every day?
article:
Rule of thumb for any trainee.
Don’t try to train 4 days a week unless you are fully adapted to training 3 days a week.
Don’t train 5 days a week unless you are fully adapted to training 4 days a week.
Etc.
Don’t train more than you need to progress.
Your progress will eventually slow down or halt. You will need to add more training at this point. This is hard if everything is already dialled to 11.
If you go straight from none or light training to too much you will get injured or burned out.
For 4–5 years I used to work with a guy who was rather overweight and unfit. Once or twice a year he would de
Continue Reading
Rule of thumb for any trainee.
Don’t try to train 4 days a week unless you are fully adapted to training 3 days a week.
Don’t train 5 days a week unless you are fully adapted to training 4 days a week.
Etc.
Don’t train more than you need to progress.
Your progress will eventually slow down or halt. You will need to add more training at this point. This is hard if everything is already dialled to 11.
If you go straight from none or light training to too much you will get injured or burned out.
For 4–5 years I used to work with a guy who was rather overweight and unfit. Once or twice a year he would decide to get fit and come to me with his training and diet plan. It was invariably extreme with a diet of oatmeal and protein shakes and smoothies, training 6–7 days a week with weights, bootcamp calisthenics, bike riding and running.
 
Every time I would advise him to reconsider. Eat normally, just a little less than usual, train three times a week, start by getting stronger, walk a bit daily. He would nod thoughtfully and go back to his navy seal hell week business.
 
He never ever stuck to his plan longer than two weeks and he is still just as unfit as he ever was, only more overweight. Don’t be like him.

article:

Suddenly a loud but whiny voice pipes up with those weird Californian cadences… ‘Gee I didn’t know they had black guys in Britain!’
 
Me and Steve stop, and Steve examines the backs of his hands theatrically. Yup, he’s still Nigerian.
 
Another nasal valley girl, whispering… ‘D’ya see his friend? He looks Puerto Rican.’
 
Well I’m Jewish actually, but I do tan well even in the gloomy E

One time me and my mate Steve went for a pint in a pub near Victoria station where people get off the train from Gatwick Airport, lots of newly arrived tourists getting their bearings and their first taste of proper beer.
 
Suddenly a loud but whiny voice pipes up with those weird Californian cadences… ‘Gee I didn’t know they had black guys in Britain!’
 
Me and Steve stop, and Steve examines the backs of his hands theatrically. Yup, he’s still Nigerian.
 
Another nasal valley girl, whispering… ‘D’ya see his friend? He looks Puerto Rican.’
 
Well I’m Jewish actually, but I do tan well even in the gloomy English summer…
 
We get a couple of pints in at the bar and sit down with the confused ladies.
 
Steve, putting on his best comedy Lagos wideboy accent, grins and says ‘Aha, I see you have noticed I am a man of colour! I am an Igbo! My tribe live by hunting elephant and repairing TVs. I do the TV repair bit…’
 
Well they didn’t get the sarcasm and the conversation kind of went downhill from there, with squeaked monosyllables from them and increasing quantities of good old British bullshit from us (in stupid accents) until they went to the loo and never came back.
 
A bit mean I know, but come on they had just flown to London, one of the most diverse cities on the planet, without a frickin’ clue what they were letting themselves in for. We did tell them to look us up in Brixton, I don’t know if they ventured there or how gobsmacked they would have been if they did.

title: Is a morning gym workout better than an evening gym workout?
article:
The last few years we’ve seen self-improvement guru’s telling people your workout needs to be done by 5 AM.
 
NOT TRUE!
 
There is even scientific evidence proving you should workout in the afternoon or evening.
Arnold Schwarzenegger definitely solved this problem by training twice a day in preparation for the Mr Olympia!
 
MUSCLE MASS DIFFERENCES MORNING VS EVENING
 
One study looked at people doing their strength workout between 6:30AM - 10:00AM and one people working out between 4:30PM - 8:00PM.
 
They found the men working out in the evening had 
more muscle mass
 than the morning group after 24 weeks.

Continue Reading
The last few years we’ve seen self-improvement guru’s telling people your workout needs to be done by 5 AM.
 
NOT TRUE!
 
There is even scientific evidence proving you should workout in the afternoon or evening.
Arnold Schwarzenegger definitely solved this problem by training twice a day in preparation for the Mr Olympia!
 
MUSCLE MASS DIFFERENCES MORNING VS EVENING
 
One study looked at people doing their strength workout between 6:30AM - 10:00AM and one people working out between 4:30PM - 8:00PM.
 
They found the men working out in the evening had 
more muscle mass
 than the morning group after 24 weeks.
 
STRENGTH DIFFERENCES MORNING VS EVENING
 
Another study looked at strength differences. The results won’t surprise you at this moment.
 
People working out in the evening increased there strength more than the morning group.
The famous strongman Hafthor Björnsson was at one point training thrice a day(!). He admitted that that might have been a bit too much though.
 
BODYBUILDERS’ BODY COMPOSITION
 
This study looked the body composition of bodybuilders. Unsurprising at this point:
 
The bodybuilders that worked out in the evening had better body composition than those who worked out in the morning.
 
The evening group had more fat-free mass and lower body fat percentages.
 
HOWEVER THE MOST IMPORTANT THING IS…
 
As always, we’re talking about averages here. And you are not a statistic.
 
If you have more strength and energy in the morning, you should hit the gym in the morning.
 
But don’t do your workouts in the morning just because some people tell you it’s better!
Thank you for reading and hopefully enjoying my answer.
 
Follow me on 
Quora
 to learn more, or follow my 
Twitter
 for daily tips and following my journey!

title: What is a good weekly workout?
article: The best weekly workout plan is balanced and includes a mix of cardiovascular exercise (like running, cycling, or swimming), strength training (using weights or bodyweight exercises), flexibility exercises (like yoga or stretching), and rest days for recovery. Ideally, aim for at least 150 minutes of moderate aerobic activity or 75 minutes of vigorous activity per week, along with strength training exercises for all major muscle groups at least twice a week. Remember, the best plan is one that fits your personal fitness level and goals.

title: How should my weekly gym workout be?
article:
In a second, I’m going to paint you a picture of what it is like working out in the morning and what it’s like working out in the evening.
 
But before that, let me say that I do both.
 
Sometimes, like this morning, I’ll get up at the crack of dawn and hit the gym.
 
Other times, I go to work and look forward to lifting weights right after.
 
It just depends on what I want to do that day.
 
Both have pros and both have cons, it’s up to you to decide what makes sense for you.
 
MORNING WORKOUT
 
Your alarm clock goes off and you wake up, it’s very early.
 
You have a small mental battle about getting out of bed but s
Continue Reading
In a second, I’m going to paint you a picture of what it is like working out in the morning and what it’s like working out in the evening.
 
But before that, let me say that I do both.
 
Sometimes, like this morning, I’ll get up at the crack of dawn and hit the gym.
 
Other times, I go to work and look forward to lifting weights right after.
 
It just depends on what I want to do that day.
 
Both have pros and both have cons, it’s up to you to decide what makes sense for you.
 
MORNING WORKOUT
 
Your alarm clock goes off and you wake up, it’s very early.
 
You have a small mental battle about getting out of bed but see your workout clothes laid out on the ground from the night before. You would feel so lazy to skip the gym and put those clothes back in the drawer, so you get up, grab your gym bag, pour a much needed coffee, and head out the door.
 
The ride to the gym is peaceful. The world is still asleep, the sun is still down, and you own the road.
 
You walk in the gym, a little more energized but still stiff. You’re already here so you might as well get started with some warmups.
 
The gym is practically empty and all the equipment is available. You pick your first exercise and begin.
 
Before you know it, the initial sleepiness has drifted away and been replaced with a fresh dose of energy.
 
You get in the zone, start sweating, and feel your heart pounding as you crush your workout.
 
Forty-five minutes later and you are done. You shower and step out of the gym heading for your car. You remember that the rest of the world is just waking up.
The sun is peaking out, the birds are stretching their wings, and the air is filled with slightly more activity than when you first got there.
 
You drive to work feeling energized, knowing that you’ve already conquered the day and improved yourself. Regardless of how the rest of the day goes, you know deep down that you already won.
 
To top if off, your mind is ready to get to work and you feel free knowing that your evening is completely open.
 
This, is the feeling of working out in the morning.
 
EVENING WORKOUT
 
The evening workout has a completely different vibe.
 
You wake up at a normal time and head to work with everyone else.
 
As the work day starts winding down, you begin thinking about your workout.
 
If you’ve eaten healthy during the day, you’re energized and ready to get in there and crush it.
 
If you haven’t eaten healthy, you feel sleepiness slowly creeping in.
 
Either way, you snag a coffee and leave, happy that the work day is over.
 
As you sip on your coffee, and listen to your pre-gym music in your car, you start feeling more excited about the gym.
 
You’re either happy to be able to leave the stress of work behind you or eager to get to the weights and lift the stress away.
 
Unlike the morning, you get to the gym and your body and mind are already awake. However, the gym is more crowded at this time of day and you have to strategically pick which exercise to start with.
 
You put your headphones in, find an empty machine, and get to work.
 
The right song comes on, you start sweating, and you feel your heart pounding as you crush your workout.
 
An hour and fifteen minutes later (due to some waiting for machines) you finish up and head for the door. You step out of the gym and head for your car, realizing that the sun is starting to lower on the horizon.
You head home feeling pumped that you conquered the day and improved yourself. The day is almost over, but you still have a couple hours to eat, shower, and do whatever you please.
 
This, is the feeling of working out in the evening.
Which is better?
 
I can’t make that decision for you.
 
Test them both out and see what fits your lifestyle.
 
At the end of the day, the best time to work out is the one that you actually stick to.

title: Can I do a mixed workout every day in the gym?
article:

Also your diet plays a pivotal role in your muscle recovery and growth.
 
Muscles are not made in the gym, but in the kitchen. Happy lifting.

There is no fix routine. Experiment and choose what works for you. Everyone has a different body and a different structure. For a start, you can follow a very basic routine as follow. I'm assuming your goal is muscle building.
 
Start every workout with a good 10–15 mins warmup and end with stretching.
 
Day 1 : Chest & Triceps
 
Add Push-ups in warmups
 
Flat Bench Press
 
Yes Inclined/Declined Bench press
 
Dumbbell flyes
 
Skull Crushers
 
Triceps push downs
 
Parallel bar dips
 
Day 2 : Cardio
 
Walk/Jog/Run. You can do variations on treadmill and incline it in between. 15 mins
 
Spinning. No stopping and increasing & decreasing resistance. 15 mins
 
Cross Trainer . Try different type of training everytime. 15 mins
 
You can add more cardio if you want. Swimming, cycling, Rope skipping etc are also very good.
 
Day 3 : Back & Biceps
 
Add wide grip Pull ups in warmup.
 
Deadlifts
 
Lat Pull downs
 
Seated row
 
Rowing Bent over/ one arm dumbbell / T-bar
 
Biceps curls with dumbbells or barbell.
 
Preacher Curls
 
Hammer Curls
 
Day 4 : Complete Rest
 
Day 5 : Legs & Shoulders
 
Add bodyweight squats, twisters and some cycling in warmup.
 
Squats
 
Leg Extension/Leg press
 
Leg curl/Walking Lunges
 
Deadlift
 
Front Barbell raise
 
Shoulder press
 
Side lateral raise
 
Day 6 : Abdominals
 
Abdominal Crunches
 
Side crunches
 
Leg raise and hold
 
Russian Twist
 
Plank
 
Day 7 : Complete rest
 
For all exercises, do 8–12 reps and 3 sets each. Choose weight for which you can do these much sets and reps. Follow a routine for 45–60 days and then change to stay away from plateaus. These exercises are interchangeable on same days. Hit and trial and see what works best for you.
 
All the best. Keep lifting :)

I’m an American, and I get pretty peeved by the utter stupidity of some of our inhabitants.
 
Let’s roll the tape, shall we?
 
1) Someone asked me where Sweden was located on the world map.
 
2) Some people like to generalize all white people as being the same: snobby, former slave-owners, uncaring. This especially applies to people with deep anti-white sentiments.
 
3) I was on AirBerlin once on a flight inbound to New York City, and when lunch came, an American mom with her family said out loud, “OH LOOK, BLUEBERRY PIE,” when it clearly was a plum pie. Imbecile.
 
4) A lot of people in my AP US History class do not know all 50 states and their locations.
 
5) 75% of my friend’s AP World History Class does not know what Brexit is.
 
The list goes on and on.
 
I don’t blame for some Americans for being completely oblivious when it comes to new experiences or what goes on in the world today— we’re bred to be ignorant. I’m sure that if my family had deep roots in the United States (my family immigrated from Poland in 1995), and if I wasn’t an inquisitive person, I’d be pretty ignorant, too.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I can't say who the most ignorant person I’ve ever met might be, because I’ve, frankly, forgotten such interactions, but I can speak of my own moments of ignorance.
 
These somewhat speak to the theme in a lot of these postings, sometimes the posters stating it overtly, that ignorance is not necessarily willful. It's sometimes a matter that one has not experienced or learnt about something as yet.
I was starting to work on my Master’s in Linguistics and up to then had never met, or even heard of, a Muslim Nigerian, let alone that the majority of northern Nigeria is primarily Muslim or that people 
Continue Reading
I can't say who the most ignorant person I’ve ever met might be, because I’ve, frankly, forgotten such interactions, but I can speak of my own moments of ignorance.
 
These somewhat speak to the theme in a lot of these postings, sometimes the posters stating it overtly, that ignorance is not necessarily willful. It's sometimes a matter that one has not experienced or learnt about something as yet.
I was starting to work on my Master’s in Linguistics and up to then had never met, or even heard of, a Muslim Nigerian, let alone that the majority of northern Nigeria is primarily Muslim or that people with rather Middle-Eastern phenotypic features live there too. I’d met with one for he first time in a Language Acquisition class, and when she’d told me that she was from Nigeria she'd added that people often think about “Black people with that thick accent, right?” I giggled a little.
I’d seen newspaper articles for assignments as a kid, and usually with photographs of people I’d been used to seeing them identify people by name in the photo caption. One day I’m looking at a photograph of a protest in Québec during one of their (seemingly many) demonstrations on independence/secession from Canada. There was one person in particular who interested me (something I now recognize as “you’d found him attractive”) and I really wanted to know his name. It upset me, though, that they didn't mention his name at all. I'd asked my mother why and she didn't have an answer, but eventually I’d figured that they can't ask everyone their name, let alone a line of at least 15 people, and then print all their names under the photograph.
I’m originally from Jamaica, and moved to the United States when I was 6, so initially I didn't sound like I was from the United States. One day when I was at boychoir practice the choirmaster had made a comment at the end of our voice training session (I don't remember the actual conversation for) that I had an accent. I wasn't sure what that meant, since no one has ever said that before, and I wasn't sure if that was a good thing or a bad thing. My friend Justin, when I’d asked him what that meant, just told me it meant I sounded different than he did, and that was okay because he had an accent too (he was from Tennessee). I didn't believe; I didn't sound 
any
 different than he did. He had me laughing the rest of the day saying periodically “See, you have an accent!” whenever I would say something.

It really depends on two things.
How unfit you are now
How intense and efficient you train
If you’re 32 stones and workout for 10 minutes everyday, you’ll likely make a lot more progress than you think. When you’re 130 kilos of pure muscle, a 10 minutes workout probably isn’t the best option for you. Losing fat can be quick, but building muscle will be very slow.
 
If you’re very fat at the start of your transformation, you’ll likely make progress really quickly, as like I said before, losing fat is very easy physically. Mentally, it’s a different battle.
 
If you’re not fat at all, chances are that you’re already ripped, you just need muscle to show it off, so simple gym work will really help you grow a better physique.
 
If you’re a little fat and have a little muscle, you could just focus on fat loss for a bit, and then build your muscle up later. There are many ways of going about this, but it all depends on how you started, and how much you want the change.
 
If you really want the change, you’ll work harder to get it quicker.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
It’s not someone I met IRL, but someone I had been having a fairly long conversation with online one year in July, maybe 20 years ago when the possibility of having a chat with someone distant was fresh and new. She was in Michigan, as I recall, and I’m in South Africa.
 
At the end of one comment, she said, “But hey, how’s life treating you? What’s your weather like today?”
 
“It’s been a very cold day, and they say it will be below freezing tonight,” I said.
 
I’m used to people from the Global North assuming that everywhere in Africa is always sultry and tropical and sunny, so I wasn’t surprised tha
Continue Reading
It’s not someone I met IRL, but someone I had been having a fairly long conversation with online one year in July, maybe 20 years ago when the possibility of having a chat with someone distant was fresh and new. She was in Michigan, as I recall, and I’m in South Africa.
 
At the end of one comment, she said, “But hey, how’s life treating you? What’s your weather like today?”
 
“It’s been a very cold day, and they say it will be below freezing tonight,” I said.
 
I’m used to people from the Global North assuming that everywhere in Africa is always sultry and tropical and sunny, so I wasn’t surprised that she was taken aback. I responded:
 
“Well, winter in Johannesburg can be very cold. We’re at a high altitude here, that’s why the area is called the Highveld - sometimes, we’ve even had snow, although that is really unusual.”
 
What shocked me was her reaction:
 
“OMG! It’s winter now in South Africa? I didn’t know that!”
 
She did not know that South Africa is in the southern hemisphere and therefore has the opposite seasons to the northern hemisphere. Yet she was a fairly well-educated person, to judge from our discussion. That was the first time I ever wondered about the failure of US schools to teach geographic basics.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

One of the most common ones was “What’s your donkey’s name?” At first I thought they were kidding. I would usually reply with a fake laugh and tell them my donkey was their namesake. They were always baffled by the fact my donkey had an American name like Brian or Britney, rather than Pedro or Conchita. (I don’t own a donkey, but I’d love to.) My answer was never funny to them, which resulted in me re
Continue Reading
Back when I was a kid, I used to spend three weeks every summer in a Camp near Orlando, Florida. I’m Mexican, so the other American kids used to pose the strangest questions about life in Mexico. One of the most common ones was “What’s your donkey’s name?” At first I thought they were kidding. I would usually reply with a fake laugh and tell them my donkey was their namesake. They were always baffled by the fact my donkey had an American name like Brian or Britney, rather than Pedro or Conchita. (I don’t own a donkey, but I’d love to.) My answer was never funny to them, which resulted in me realizing they weren’t joking. I’m aware they were just kids, maybe ten or eleven years old, but ever since that happened, I began to think of Americans as very intelligent and civilized, but quite ignorant when it came to information regarding other countries, or sometimes even their own. For example, I once took a Business Cultures class in Berlin where all the students were Americans, except for me, and none of them knew what the highest mountain in the United States’ was, except for me, a Mexican. I acknowledge this reply could be interpreted as a generalization, which I think it is, because most of the smartest, decent and dedicated people I know are from the U.S., but I do think ignorance is one of the main reasons why a clown is currently working in the Oval Office. Also, we’re not much better off. A clown governs Mexico too, and ignorance is a main cause as well.

This is my true story:
 
Introduction :
 
Yes. I’m a poor guy as far as my financial situation is concerned not with my attitude or dreams.
 
I come from a very poor family background with Big Dreams. We used to live in a small village with a monthly income of Rs. 6,000. My mother who is a tailor who is the only source of our family, she sacrificed her life for the benefit of our family development but things are not going as she used to think. I don’t want to talk about my father, though physically he is there, he is not contributing to our family in any way rather he used to torture my mother every time. He is completely addicted to alcohol. I had a younger brother who is completely deaf and dumb, this has become one more challenging task for our family. As we are not financially capable, no one used to support us, including our relatives. I can’t explain my pain within crispy words. Nowadays, the so-called Vitamin M (money) is the only criteria for anything, you may accept it or you may not accept it.
 
Aiming :
 
So, I aimed big to wage a war against my poverty, I decided to become a Civil Servant, so that I’ll get recognition and fame. At that time, I thought, education was the only solution for me.
 
My Journey :
 
I had no money to go and stay in Hyderabad. So, I’ve written Osmania University Entrance examination for my post graduation on the advice of my English Lecturer, actually my plan is to get shelter and then prepare for my IAS examination. By God’s grace everything went very well. I got good rank and I joined there for my post graduation. (For my preparation only)
 
Ashok Nagar, Hyderabad :
 
I’ve no idea about the civil services examination, so I decided to go for coaching. I’ve had my search for the best coaching institution in Hyderabad, where thousands and lakhs of people are roaming around the Ashok Nagar cross roads in the name of IAS coaching. Actually, it is more than a business and business of business. I’m not in a position to cope up with big institutions where the crowd is so high. Then, I decided to choose the institution with minimum strength.
 
Civil Services Mission:
 
I don’t want to mention the institution name but I found it. Things were going on my way. But here comes challenge again, I need to pay Rs.60,000 for my coaching. I had no idea how to pay.
 
Thanks for the Internet. I used to search on the Google for helping hands to support me, actually I’ve sent more than 2500 emails to different NGOs and trusts all over the India, including few persons individually whom I found on Google.
 
I got few positive responses. Fortunately, I got support from them to continue my preparation. I paid the fee and I started working on my mission.
 
Struggles and Sorrows:
 
I had only three pairs of dresses. If I want to go for coaching I’ve to wear the one dress for two to three days.
 
I did all the Hard Work what I can do. My only ambition is to get into the civil services. No other exams.
 
I’ve written IAS examination 4 times in a row but failed to clear it. Twice, I had my mains. But no result. As I’m zero at maths, I was not in a position to take any other bank or SSC examination.
 
Day and night struggles, I’ve had my tears. Things were changed at my home, mother and brother got hospitalized. My father is not caring anything about our family. I came back I’ve taken care of my family.
 
Failure and Impact :
 
Everybody is used to point me, they used to show me as a symbol of failure. I may failed in my IAS examination but I’m not going to fail in my life. I’m a fighter, though I failed in civil services, I learned a lot from the journey. How can a single sheet of examination paper can decide my future? Everybody is Unique, right?
 
No contacts. No relationships. No money.
 
Approaching the Politicians :
 
As I’ve had immense knowledge as far as administration and policy making is concern, I approached few politicians to work as an assistant to them. But got rejected everywhere.
 
Entrepreneurial Journey :
 
Formal education will make you a living but Self-education will make you a Fortune. As the start-up revolution is going in India, I had a question in my mind – why don’t I start my career as an entrepreneur?
 
I’ve had my ideas, I worked on it but again the lack of funding has become the major concern for me. Whatever the start-up idea I’ve in my mind, it has become a $100 million dollars company in USA. Of course, you may believe or you may not.
 
Now???
 
Now, I’m no longer in a position to write any examination or no longer want to work under someone. I want to become a self-made entrepreneur in any way. I’m not going to give up on my dreams.
 
“if the plan is not working, change the plan but not the Goals”.
 
“Body has it’s limitations but mind has no limits”
 
This information age is giving enormous amount of opportunity to each and every individual. I wanted to catch it and cash out.
 
Your Help is Needed :
 
I would love to welcome your suggestions or advices or help or criticism in any way.
 
I may not be the perfect guy to answer you but I can feel and express my opinion by stepping into your shoes in a perfect way.
 
I’m not giving up rather I’m challenging myself to get what I want. I’ll persist until I succeed. For me, the true happiness always lies in Fighting.
 
Thanks For Being Awesome,
 
SURESH MADHA !!!

He laid eyes on me, a proud Korean-American, and immediately conjured up images of a divided nation, a ruthless communist regime, and a people suffering under oppressive rule. His well-intentioned, albeit woefully misguided, concern was both amusing and disheartening.
 
This common misconception highlights the immense 
Continue Reading
A Tale of Two Koreas
 
I've encountered a myriad of fascinating individuals throughout my life, but none quite as perplexing as the man at the gas station. I stood there, a simple transaction morphing into an unexpected cultural clash, chuckling at the sheer absurdity of the situation.
 
He laid eyes on me, a proud Korean-American, and immediately conjured up images of a divided nation, a ruthless communist regime, and a people suffering under oppressive rule. His well-intentioned, albeit woefully misguided, concern was both amusing and disheartening.
 
This common misconception highlights the immense power of media and the alarming ease with which harmful stereotypes can take root. While it's understandable to be curious about diverse cultures, it's paramount that we approach them with open minds and a genuine willingness to learn.
 
In the end, I left the gas station with a few extra snacks and a humorous anecdote etched in my memory. It serves as a stark reminder that even in this age of unprecedented information, ignorance can still persist. But perhaps, with a little more understanding and empathy, we can bridge the divide between cultures and cultivate a more compassionate world.

An older woman raised her hand.

Continue Reading
I recently went to a play, a major theme of which was racial inequality.
 
After the show, there was a talkback with the cast.
 
The facilitator of the talkback asked the audience if they had any questions or comments about the show.
 
An older woman raised her hand.
 
“When I was growing up, we called ’em ‘negroes’. We used to have one who cleaned our house. I tried to teach her French, but she didn’t want to learn. That was their problem. They didn’t want to learn anything.”
 
The facilitator paused, and one of the cast members raised his hand.
 
“When my grandmother was growing up, she was a black maid for a white family. She spent her entire life being told she wasn’t worth enough to teach and that learning was a waste of her time. She was told that what she said didn’t matter. Why would she want to learn? She didn’t think anyone should waste their time teaching her.
 
“I’m not saying that means your experience is invalid, but there are different perspectives. We should talk about all of them. Thank you for your comment.”
 
The woman in that audience may have been near the top of the list of the most ignorant people. But because the facilitator and the cast didn’t shoot her down or berate her, she had a chance to learn.
 
After the talkback, she told the facilitator:
 
“Thank you for doing this show. It was great.”
 
Hopefully that woman left that theatre a little more aware than she came in.

After her husband committed adultery and left her holding the baby (literally), she began to seek out feminist theologies that related to egalitarian marriage. Lots of Australian women are in such groups. You don’t get to tell us what to

She flew out to Australia for a funeral. She was from Texas. She’d been a complementarian right wing christian wife (submitted to her husband) with a million children that she’d home schooled. After her husband committed adultery and left her holding the baby (literally), she began to seek out feminist theologies that related to egalitarian marriage. She was soon convinced that the egalitarians were closer to scriptural accuracy than the complementarians, so she joined several feminist and egalitarian Christian pages.
 
Lots of Australian women are in such groups. You don’t get to tell us what to do unless you’re literally god- not a representative. Husbands are just humble sinners like the rest of us.
 
She was excited to have some friends from the State she was visiting for the funeral - Queensland - the sunshine state. We three were in an egalitarian group that met for coffee several times per year. We knew each other. When she asked to meet us in the flesh we agreed.
 
We all drove to the Gold Coast and met at the Surf Club for lunch.
she boasted about how big Texas is (Queensland is 2 1/2 times bigger)
she boasted about the then President Trump and the mighty things he was doing around the world for economic and military security. (We all tried not to barf. We’re feminists with no time at all for boastful adulterers, and we couldn’t think of anything he’d done for Australia except for nearly pick a fight with Kim in North Korea which would have invited a few missiles shot at us).
she rejoiced that the socialist Democrats were on the run from the Big Bad Republican wolf Trump. We looked uncomfortably at each other. (We’re all socialists. Australia has a sitting socialist government at the time of writing).
She boasted about the success of her homeschooling and denigrated public schools and public school teachers (I’m a teacher - I work for Education Queensland).
in short, she was the epitome of the American stereotype. She knew nothing about Australia or Australian politics, but she blithely assumed that we were a kind of mini America.
 
Last year I visited America and was delighted to find that she was an anomoly. I only met one MAGA hat at the Houston airport, and everyone else seemed normal.

title: What are the pros and cons of training full-body every day?
article:
Bad, no.
 
But not ideal.
 
The problem is the muscles need time to rest.
 
So if you want to do full body workouts every day, that is fine. But it’s not the optimal way toward muscle and strength growth.
 
Two better options:
Full body workouts three days a week with at least a day in between workouts, or
Some type of split routine, where the different muscles are never taxed two days in a row
The point is for muscles to get 48+ hours of rest in between being beaten up in the exercise routines.
 
If you like full body workouts, but you don’t want to have days you don’t exercise, there are other options for the
Continue Reading
Bad, no.
 
But not ideal.
 
The problem is the muscles need time to rest.
 
So if you want to do full body workouts every day, that is fine. But it’s not the optimal way toward muscle and strength growth.
 
Two better options:
Full body workouts three days a week with at least a day in between workouts, or
Some type of split routine, where the different muscles are never taxed two days in a row
The point is for muscles to get 48+ hours of rest in between being beaten up in the exercise routines.
 
If you like full body workouts, but you don’t want to have days you don’t exercise, there are other options for the “rest” days. You can use them for cardio. Stretching. Yoga. Long walks.
 
You certainly can, and probably should, exercise every single day. It’s good for the body. Great for the soul! But if you’re going to put your body through all that stress, you should definitely seek the path to the best results.

A waitress who couldn’t do basic math.
 
Restaurant bill came to $10.16. I gave her $20.16, asked her to give me $8 back and keep $2 for herself. She rang it up on the cash register correctly, which shows I was due $10 in change. She very slowly counted $8, then held it in her hand for several seconds, looking confused. I told her, “yes, that’s mine, and take $2 for yourself. She took $2 from the 8, and handed me 6. I tried re-explaining, but a line started forming behind me, and people were laughing. I realized that any further discussion would just humiliate the poor girl, so I just said, ‘we’re good, thank you’ and left.
Older Story:
 
My sister-in-law’s husband had a child from a previous marriage. My mother-in-law didn’t accept the little girl as a grandchild, or even as a sibling to her daughter’s two sons. She denied that the father was the father, although she looked exactly like him, as well as resembling her half-brothers. She and her father were both blue-eyed blondes, same cheeky smiles, same nose, etc.
 
Anyway, as the girl approached adolescence, she got a little chubby. My mother-in-law cited this as more evidence that her father couldn’t be her father, because “only black girls have butts like that”, ergo her mother must have cheated with a black man.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Cheating somewhat, as I haven’t met this person, but they certainly qualify as an ignorant American.
 
An American tourist, on a visit to Windsor Castle inquired: “Why did they build the Castle so close to Heathrow Airport?”
 
Now I don’t expect every tourist to know that many of the grander English castles were built during the High Middle Ages.
 
But I would have expected every single one of them to surmise that a high stone-walled structure designed to keep out invaders predates the age of mass air travel.

title: Which 3 exercises would give me the most complete workout?
article:
Most good exercises target multiple parts of the body. Instead of 3 per body part, I'll give you 6 per area plus 4 for the core (I mean... you want those Jesus abs don't you?)
 
Upper body: bench press, row, chin up/wide grip pull up or the relevant cable machine exercises if you can't get chinups/pullups right now, shoulder press/push press,
Lower body: squat, deadlift, lunge/step up, supine hip extension/split squat
Core: plank (60 s), side plank (45 s), plank with pull down (4x20), side plank with row (4x20)
 
Do a 4 workout split of these exercises (upper A, lower A, upper B, lower B). Always be
Continue Reading
Most good exercises target multiple parts of the body. Instead of 3 per body part, I'll give you 6 per area plus 4 for the core (I mean... you want those Jesus abs don't you?)
 
Upper body: bench press, row, chin up/wide grip pull up or the relevant cable machine exercises if you can't get chinups/pullups right now, shoulder press/push press,
Lower body: squat, deadlift, lunge/step up, supine hip extension/split squat
Core: plank (60 s), side plank (45 s), plank with pull down (4x20), side plank with row (4x20)
 
Do a 4 workout split of these exercises (upper A, lower A, upper B, lower B). Always be doing the first two exercises. Switch between the ones with the slash every other workout. Do one of the core exercises every work out. Since you're going for mass, do 5 sets of 5 reps except for the core exercises.
 
A few pro-tips:
1. Don't focus too much on your arms. Most compound exercises should cover your arms. You don't need to dedicate an entire section to just arms.
2. Avoid machines. As a rule of thumb, the only machines you want to use are the ones where you're pulling a cable.
3. Make sure you take the first two workouts easy so you can get your form down. Having bad form will break you.
4. Muscles are built in the kitchen, not the gym. If you're serious about putting on mass, you need to eat 4000-5000 calories a day, depending on your body type.

title: How long will it take to get big if doing full body workouts every day with heavy weights?
article:

Find the weight that you can do 8 to 12 reps for 3 sets. Do as many chin ups as you can.
Increase weight by 5 lbs. on all exercises when you can do 13 on last set, except The Press, increase it by 2.5 lbs. Gains will be slow with only one day a week.
Rest 90 yo 120 seconds between sets.

Continue Reading
The short answer is yes. However, it also depends on 2 things; Movement choice and intensity. There are 6 important movements; the Squat (bar on back), Deadlift, Press (standing, overhead barbell), Bench Press, Bent Barbell Row, and chin up (Hands facing towards you).
Find the weight that you can do 8 to 12 reps for 3 sets. Do as many chin ups as you can.
Increase weight by 5 lbs. on all exercises when you can do 13 on last set, except The Press, increase it by 2.5 lbs. Gains will be slow with only one day a week.
Rest 90 yo 120 seconds between sets.
The most important thing is the mechanics on all exercises. Pay a trusted trainer to help you master the mechanics. Also, if your older, invest in a belt.
Diet: Heavy on the protein the day of and after your training. Don’t skip the good fats. More carbs the day before and on training day. Figure out your daily calorie needs and stick to it.
Gains will be slow, but you will be very surprised at how your body responds. Stick with THESE basic movements. All other movements IN THE WORLD are merely variations of the first five movements. They are the only ones you really need. The chin is a variation of the barbell row. But it isolates the biceps, not a hugely important muscle, but today’s social standards seem to demand that they be trained in some form of isolation.
 
Remember, mechanics are the key. Perform them right to stay healthy and become strong.

Continue Reading
Oh boy, 
there are so many to choose from
 - where should we start?
As Sheri already mentioned, it always helps to share your goals, which could be anything from losing weight to toning-up or building muscle mass.
 
How would the exercises be different, depending on my goals?
 
1/ 
Weight-Loss
 
If you are actively looking to reduce your bodyweight, then you want to be doing a greater percentage of cardio, in addition to some high-rep resistance (bodyweight) exercises.
 
2/ 
Toning-Up
 
If you are happy with your overall bodyweight and shape, and just want to tone-up those muscles then you should be doing more high-rep resistance work alongside some good HIIT workouts to tone the muscles and increase your strength and stamina.
 
3/ 
Building Muscles-Mass
 
In order to build additional lean muscle-mass you should be doing strength workouts with weights, concentrating on the main compound exercises to help build all-round body strength and muscle.
 
Will I need to go to a Gym or can I train at home?
 
In reality you could train for any of the above goals either at a gym or at home. Training at a gym is the safer option due to having specialist fitness instructors on-hand to help, plus all the required equipment is ready and waiting.
 
For home workouts, the majority of people would only have a small selection of exercise equipment at home such as dumbbells and resistance bands - possibly some kettlebells and a barbell set if you are really keen!
 
For weight-loss and toning-up - you hardly need any equipment at all apart from your body and some space, or you could even train outdoors!
 
For Strength Training, i.e. building muscles, you would be best working out at a gym, otherwise you will need to make additional home purchases for equipment such as a bench and even a squat rack!
Anyway, here are some exercises you could easily do on a weekly basis for weight-loss …
 
Weight-Loss Workout
Monday - Moderate Intensity Walk (30 Minutes minimum)
Tuesday - 
Home Bodyweight Workout
 (20 minutes)
Wednesday - Moderate Intensity Walk (30 Minutes minimum)
Thursday - 
Home Bodyweight Workout
 (20 minutes - Pick another)
Friday - Moderate Intensity Walk (30 Minutes minimum)
Saturday - Rest Day
Sunday - Fun Sports Day - Swimming, Cycling, Tennis etc (30 minutes)
Have fun exercising :-)

title: How to workout
article:
Traditional cardio is at best a waste of time, and at worst counter productive. Forget it.. especially for your goals. Ill spare you the long drawn out explaination as to why.
 
To get toned, you need weights and proper nutrition. To lose the fat you have to get your nutrition on point.. theres just no way around it. Its 80% of the game. I recommend a paleo diet consisting of organic meats and vegetables, some fruit and nuts and the occasional root tubor 2 or so days a week. But meat and veggies os the way to balance your hormones and lose the fat.
 
As for training.. if youve never lifted before i 
Continue Reading
Traditional cardio is at best a waste of time, and at worst counter productive. Forget it.. especially for your goals. Ill spare you the long drawn out explaination as to why.
 
To get toned, you need weights and proper nutrition. To lose the fat you have to get your nutrition on point.. theres just no way around it. Its 80% of the game. I recommend a paleo diet consisting of organic meats and vegetables, some fruit and nuts and the occasional root tubor 2 or so days a week. But meat and veggies os the way to balance your hormones and lose the fat.
 
As for training.. if youve never lifted before i URGE you to hire a trainer. You don't have to work out with a trainer for ever but it is important to learn proper form and technique learn what exercises work what muscle groups and Lauren how hard to push yourself how long to wait between exercises order of exercises excetera excetera. Doing research is great but as I'm sure you have noticed for every answer you find you will find someone who says the opposite. Without a professional guiding you often times it's hard to know what advice to take comma granted not all “expert” advice in the health and field industry is really expert LOL. And not all trainers are created equal. You want someone with at least a year experience ask them about their previous clients and their success stories ask them about their methods and protocols and the reason why they use those methods. If they can't give you concrete answers to those questions look for a different trainer.
 
I recommend I recommend weight training 2 days a week and doing two days of interval cardio. I like weights on Monday Thursday cardio Tuesday Friday. Focus on major muscle group multi-joint compound movements. No I promise you you will not get big bulky muscles. You will get strong lean and toned. Working the big muscles using the compound exercises burns the most calories and elicit the greatest hormone response and it's the hormones that really get the job done. Lyft hard-and-fast good in work hard for about 30 minutes and go home there's no reason to lift for more than that the training is determined by effort not volume or duration. So push hard for a short time until you feel and then go do something else. Interval cardio means going as hard as you can for a short period And then resting for a short period and repeating. The routine I like is only 4 minutes you go all out maximum Sprint for 20 seconds then walk for 10 seconds and repeat eight times. That routine is clinically proven four times more effective at both muscle building and fat burning when performed twice a week with 100% maximum effort than 60 Minutes of traditional steady state cardio performed five days a week. Yes you read correctly 8 minutes is superior to 300 minutes as long as you push 100%. Good luck.

article:

An American who claimed to be a scientist but believed in creationism.

A hardcore Trump supporter. 
An American who claimed to be a scientist but believed in creationism.
 
I met this American old gentleman at a Safari lodge in India. After some chit-chat around the magnificent Royal Bengal Tiger, the conversation veers towards how Indians co-exist peacefully with wild animals.
 
Him : I am also impressed by the way you Indians respect the elderly. And that is because your religion teaches you that.
 
Me: it's a cultural thing. Not a religious thing.
 
Him: In America, we have thrown religion out of our schools and colleges. And we are degrading.
 
Me: Really ?? US continues to lead the world in producing amazing intellectual talent.
 
Him: Not anymore. But it will change under Trump. He will make things right.
 
Me: Really? From whatever little I have seen and heard him talk, he doesn't seem credible.
 
Him: Don't trust what you see on CNBC and CNN. They have hidden agendas.
 
The next day, after some conversation around wildlife ….
 
Him: My colleagues who are in research, are convinced that only God could have created us. The DNA is such a wonderful piece of engineering, that it couldn't be created by itself.
 
Me: Interesting. Are you in scientific research?
 
Him: Mainly academics. Teaching.And I teach my students to keep their minds open about speculative theories such as evolution.
 
Me: So you are a professor. Which university?
 
Him: Not a university.
 
Me: Some institute then. Which one ?
 
Him: XYZ School.
 
I look up the school on Google and it turns out to be a primary / middle school.
 
Best of luck, America !

My most valuable possessions are probably my 3 year old Lenovo laptop and the PS4 that my uncle had given me for Christmas last year. Other than that the main things I own are just my clothes, my cards (MTG mainly), and a few games and books.
